properties.name: Cigars Of The Pharoah (Posrt Sa'id)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanTintin and the cigars of the Pharoah: Tintin and his dog Snowy are on a cruise ship in the Mediterranean Sea when they meet Dr Sarcophagus, an Egyptologist, who tries unsuccessfully to keep a paper from going overboard. The absent-minded Sarcophagus then realizes that the paper is not the Kih-Oskh papyrus he thought it was but some other negligible document. Sarcophagus believes that the papyrus will lead him to the undiscovered tomb of the Pharaoh Kih-Oskh and invites Tintin to accompany him.

properties.name: Crab With Th Golden Claws (Morocco and the Sahar)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanCrab With the Golden Claws: The ramblings of a drunken man and a scrap of paper from what appears to be a tin of crab-meat leads Tintin to the ship Karaboudjan, where he is captured by a syndicate of criminals who have been hiding opium in the crab tins.

properties.name: Flight 714 (Jakarta)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanFlight 714: Tintin, Captain Haddock and Calculus are on their way to Sydney for an international conference on space exploration. While their flight makes a refueling stop in Jakarta. The flight is then highjacked. A series of very extraordinary events follow.

properties.name: Prisoners Of The Sun (Peru)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanPrisoners Of The Sun: Tintin and Captain Haddock arrive in Peru to look for Professor Calculus, following the events in The Seven Crystal Balls, which ended with Calculus being kidnapped for putting on the bracelet of the mummified Inca, Rascar Capac. Calculus slips through their fingers, and they set off on the trail of the natives who have taken him. It leads them to the mountain town of Jauga where an attempt is made on their lives by sabotaging the train.

properties.name: Th Black Island (Sussex - England)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Black Island: While walking in the countryside Tintin sees a plane making an emergency landing, and goes to help, but as he comes near he is shot by the pilot. Tintin recovers at a hospital where police detectives Thomson and Thompson inform him that a similar plane has crashed in a field in Sussex, England. Tintin decides to investigate for himself.

properties.name: The Blue Lotus (Delhi)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Blue Lotus: Tintin has a brief encounter with the Indian Maharajah

properties.name: The Blue Lotus (Shanghai)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Blue Lotus: In Cigars of the Pharaoh, Tintin pursued an international group of drug distributors through the Middle and Far East. He managed to catch them all, except for the leader, who fell down a ravine. His body was not found. In order to unravel more of the network and stop the opium production at the source, Tintin travels to Shanghai, a major city-port in China, where he is eagerly awaited by the assassins of the opium consortium.

properties.name: The Castefiore Emerald (England)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Castefiore Emerald: Bianca Castafiore, famous opera Diva and scourge of the Captain decides to invite herself to Marlinspike for a holiday. All manner of mayhem ensues.

properties.name: The Land Of The Black Gold (Middle East)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Land Of The Black Gold: The world is on the verge of war when car engines begin exploding all over the world. The root cause appears to be tampered fuel supplies. Following different leads, Tintin and Thomson and Thompson set off for Khemed (a fictional country in the Middle East) on board a petrol tanker. Upon arrival, the three are arrested by the authorities under various charges. The Thompsons are cleared and released, but Tintin is kidnapped by Arab insurgents.

properties.name: The Shooting Star (Iceland)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanThe Shooting Star: Tintin is out walking with his dog Snowy one night, and notices an extra star in the Great Bear. When he reaches home, he dials the Observatory. They pay no heed to his call. This incident is only to be followed by a soothsayer telling Tintin that Judgement Day was near.

properties.name: Tintin In The Land Of The Soviet (Moscow)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanTintin and his dog Snowy are sent on a mission to Moscow by the newspaper he works for. A train is blown up by an agent of the Soviet secret police, and Tintin is blamed for the "accident". Tin Tin in the Land Of The Soviets.

properties.name: Tintin in America (Chicago, Illinois)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanTintin In America: Tintin is sent to Chicago, Illinois to clean up the city\'s criminals, after encountering Al Capone\'s gangsters in the last book, Tintin in the Congo. Tintin is captured by gangsters several times, and also meets Al Capone. Although Tintin temporarily captures Capone and some of his henchmen, the policeman he calls to help arrest the gangsters do not believe his story and arrest him.

properties.name: Tintin in Tibet
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanTintin in Tibet: Tintin reads about a plane crash in the Gosain Than massif in the Himalayas. That evening at the hotel, Tintin dozes off while playing chess with the Captain, who is having trouble deciding on his next move. Tintin has a vivid dream that his young Chinese friend Chang Chong-Chen survived a plane crash, and awakes with a violent start, yelling "Tchang!" and throwing the whole recreation room into chaos. The next morning, he reads in the paper that it was Chang\'s plane that crashed in Tibet. Believing that his dream was a telepathic vision, Tintin travels to Kathmandu, followed by a skeptical Captain Haddock.

properties.name: Tintin in the congo (Congo)
properties.description: Posted by ZanemanTin Tin and Snowy prepare for their trip into the Congo not knowing the adventures in store for them in Tin Tin in the Congo
